title: Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collec. 60 (WWI, WWII 4)
description:
Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 60 (WW-I, WW-II 4):

We have 35 title here:

-  Biess & Moeller (Ed.) - Histories of the Aftermath; the Legacies of the Second World War in Europe (2010)

-  Blom - Fracture; Life & Culture in the West, 1918-1938 (2015)

-  Burgschwentner et al (Eds.) - Other Fronts, Other Wars; First World War Studies on the Eve of the Centennial (2014)

-  Carter - George, Nicholas and Wilhelm; Three Royal Cousins and the Road to World War I (2009)

-  Cohen - The War Come Home; Disabled Veterans in Britain and Germany, 1914-1939 (2001)

-  Collingham - The Taste of War; World War II and the Battle for Food (2011)

-  Emden - The Quick and the Dead; Fallen Soldiers and Their Families in the Great War (2011)

-  Englund - The Beauty and the Sorrow; an Intimate History of the First World War (2011)

-  Ericsson & Simonsen (Eds.) - Children of World War II; the Hidden Enemy Legacy (2005)

-  Ford - Eden to Armageddon; World War I in the Middle East (2010)

-  Gardner - The Failure to Prevent World War I; the Unexpected Armageddon (2015)

-  Guehenno - Diary of the Dark Years, 1940-1944; Collaboration, Resistance, and Daily Life in Occupied Paris (2014)

-  Horne (Ed.) - A Companion to World War I (2010)

-  Jackson - France, the Dark Years, 1940-1944 (2001)

-  Kershaw - Fateful Choices; Ten Decisions that Changed the World, 1940-1941 (2007)

-  Lewis - True World War I Stories (2009)

-  Liddle et al - The Great World War, 1914-1945; Vol. 1, Lightning Strikes Twice (2000)

-  Mawson - Evacuees; Children's Lives on the WW2 Home Front (2014)

-  McGreal - The War on Hospital Ships, 1914-1918 (2008)

-  Neiberg - Potsdam; The End of World War II and the Remaking of Europe (2015)

-  Neilson - Britain, Soviet Russia and the Collapse of the Versailles Order, 1919-1939 (2006)

-  Neitzel & Welzer - Soldaten; On Fighting, Killing, and Dying; the Secret WWII Transcripts of German POWs (2012)

-  Nock - The Myth of a Guilty Nation (1922)

-  Paddock - World War I and Propaganda (2014)

-  Reeves - Infamy; the Shocking Story of the Japanese-American Interment in World War II (2015)

-  Sheffield - Forgotten Victory; the First World War Myths and Realities (2001)

-  Silbey - The British Working Class and Enthusiasm for War, 1914-1916 (2005)

-  Simkins et al - The First World War; the War to End All Wars (2003)

-  Stevenson - With Our Backs to the Wall; Victory and Defeat in 1918 (2011)

-  Suvorov - The Chief Culprit; Stalin's Grand Design to Start World War II (2008)

-  Taliaferro et al (Eds.) - The Challenge of Grand Strategy; the Great Powers and the Broken Balance between the World Wars (2012)

-  Tolstoy - Victims of Yalta; the Secret Betrayal of the Allies, 1944-1947 (1977)

-  van Emden - Meeting the Enemy; the Human Face of the Great War (2013)

-  Woodward - Hell in the Holy Land; World War I in the Middle East (2006)

-  Yorke - The Trench; Life and Death on the Western Front, 1914-1918 (2014)
